attributes.action: lead the way to establish fair and accurate reporting in the general media (Press, TV and books) by taking immediate legal action to protect his reputation as Chancellor and Prime Minister by suing the author Andrew Rawnsley for libel in his book, The End of the Party.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Mr Brown is accused by Mr Rawnsley of bullying staff and actually hitting people. The accusations, taken in length as written, are a heinous reflection on a senior politician. Mr Brown has refuted the accusations. A serious issue of credibility arises here. Only one of them can be right. If it is Mr Rawnsley, then Mr Brown has an anger management problem and his ability to lead must be in question. If, however, Mr Rawnsley is exaggerating what is perhaps only very  strong character then Mr Rawnsley should be held to account. The Prime Minister should give example of his strong character and bring the matter to a head in a court of law.

rejection.details: If Gordon Brown were to sue it would be in a personal capacity, unrelated to his role as Prime Minister.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
